org.sd.nlp
Class StringWrapperTokenPointer

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.nlp.StringWrapperTokenPointer
All Implemented Interfaces:
TokenPointer
Direct Known Subclasses:
LoStringWrapperTokenPointer, LslStringWrapperTokenPointer, SoStringWrapperTokenPointer
public class StringWrapperTokenPointer
extends java.lang.Object
implements TokenPointer

StringWrapper implementation of the token pointer interface.

This implementation is based on using StringWrapper.SubString for tokenization.

Author:
Spence Koehler

revise

public final TokenPointer revise()
Get another token pointer based on shortening or lengthening the referenced token's size. This revision strategy must be correlated with the "next" strategy.

Specified by:
revise in interface TokenPointer

next

public final TokenPointer next(boolean allowSkip)
Get the next token pointer that immediately follows this one. The strategy for building the next token (longest, shortest, etc.) must be correlated with the "revise" strategy.

Specified by:
next in interface TokenPointer
Parameters:
allowSkip - if true, allow skipping text within limits established on construction; otherwise, don't skip.

public boolean isGuessable()
Determine whether this token pointer is guessable.

Note that calling this method can have side-effects on the instance.
